thread.title: Texas teen becomes sixth HS football player to die from injury this season
thread.title_full: Texas teen becomes sixth HS football player to die from injury this season

title: Texas teen becomes sixth HS football player to die from injury this season
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Texas teen becomes sixth HS football player to die from injury this season Cam’ron Matthews, a junior at Alto High School in Texas, has died after being injured during a high school football game Friday night. Post to Facebook Texas teen becomes sixth HS football player to die from injury this season Cam’ron Matthews, a junior at Alto High School in Texas, has died after being injured during a high school football game Friday night. Check out this story on wtsp.com: http://on.wtsp.com/1RPpYjs Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Texas teen becomes sixth HS football player to die from injury this season USA TODAY 6:37 a.m. EDT October 18, 2015 Cam’Ron Matthews CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
( USA TODAY ) -- Cam’ron Matthews, a junior at Alto High School in Texas, has died after being injured during a high school football game Friday night. 
Matthews becomes the sixth high school football player to die since early September. 
Matthews collapsed on the sideline Friday evening late in the first half with what was initially reported to be a seizure. According to a witness, he told teammates in a huddle before a kickoff that he felt dizzy. The witness did not know whether Matthews was on the field for the touchdown that preceded the kickoff. 
He was airlifted to a hospital in Tyler, Texas, and was listed in critical condition early Saturday afternoon. 
He was pronounced dead shortly after 6 p.m. Eastern, the Alto schools superintendent confirmed to KTVU.com. A cause of death has not yet been determined. 
A vigil was being held at the school’s football field Saturday night. We have a @KETK crew at a vigil for Cam'Ron Matthews in Alto. We'll have the latest details at 10. pic.twitter.com/RCpFf8ld9F 
According to the National Center for Catastrophic Sports Injury Research at the University of North Carolina, five high school players died last season of causes directly related to football such as head and spine injuries. Seven more high school players died from indirect causes such as heatstroke. 
Thus far this season, Tyrell Cameron of Franklin Parish (La.); Ben Hamm from Welseyan Christian School in Bartlesville, Okla.; Evan Murray from Warren Hills (N.J.) Regional; Kenney Bui of Evergreen (Wash.); and Rod Williams from Burke County (Ga.) have all died. All but Williams died after being injured on the field; Williams collapsed minute into a Sept. 22 practice and died Oct. 5 from what doctors believe is a congenital heart defect.
